newsitem.title: MONGOLIA: Mongolia 1996 inflation hits 58.7 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Mongolia 1996 inflation hits 58.7 pct yr/yr.

text.p: The Bank of Mongolia on Thursday said it had calculated the country's annual inflation rate for 1996 at a year-on-year 58.7 percent.
The central bank said it still needed to check the difference between its figure and the number from the State Statistical Office.
The State Statistical Office said earlier that inflation for the year was 53.2 percent. Mongolian Prime Minister M. Enkhsaikhan said this week inflation was about 56 percent.
The central bank figure was calculated based on State Statistical Office consumer index prices, the bank said.
In 1995 inflation in Mongolia ran at 53.1 percent, compared with 66.3 percent in 1994, 183 percent in 1993 and 325.5 percent in 1992.
